intro: Raphanus sylvestris, commonly known as wild radish, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers arranged in umbels, followed by long, slender pods containing rounded seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its pungent odor and edible leaves and seeds, which have been used in traditional cuisines.
